al_smp.h

13#ifndef _AL_SMP_H
14#define _AL_SMP_H
15
16#include "th_types.h"
17/* File: al_smp.h
18 Abstractions of thread functions
19 EEMBC AL defines 3 types: thread, mutex and condition,
20 and functions to create and use them.
21 These functions are used by MITH to run and manage workloads.
22 They should also be used by benchmarks that implement concurrency
23 within the scope of the benchmark.
24*/
25
26 /* Basic primitives */
27#if USE_NATIVE_PTHREAD==1
28 #include <pthread.h>
29 #define al_thread_t pthread_t
30 #define al_mutex_t pthread_mutex_t
31 #define al_cond_t pthread_cond_t
32
33 #define al_mutex_init(_mutex) pthread_mutex_init(_mutex,NULL)
34 #define al_mutex_lock(a) pthread_mutex_lock(a)
35 #define al_mutex_trylock(a) pthread_mutex_trylock(a)
36 #define al_mutex_unlock(a) pthread_mutex_unlock(a)
37 #define al_mutex_destroy(a) pthread_mutex_destroy(a)
38
39 #define al_cond_init(_cond) pthread_cond_init(_cond,NULL)
40 #define al_cond_signal(a) pthread_cond_signal(a)
41 #define al_cond_broadcast(a) pthread_cond_broadcast(a)
42 #define al_cond_wait(a,b) pthread_cond_wait((a),(b))
43 #define al_cond_destroy(a) pthread_cond_destroy(a)
44
45 #define al_thread_create(_thread, _start_r, _arg) pthread_create(_thread,NULL,_start_r,_arg)
46 #define al_thread_join(a,b) pthread_join(a,b)
47
48#else /* pthread library not availble */
49#if USE_SINGLE_CONTEXT
50 typedef void *al_thread_t; /* dummy */
51 typedef void *al_mutex_t; /* dummy */
52 typedef void *al_cond_t; /* dummy */
53#elif AL_THREAD_U32
54/* thread type is a u32 */
55 typedef e_u32 al_thread_t; /* identify a thread */
56 typedef e_u32 al_mutex_t; /* identify a mutex */
57 typedef e_u32 al_cond_t; /* identify a condition variable */
58#elif AL_THREAD_VC
59/* thread type from the win32 pthread library */
60 typedef struct {
61 void * p; /* Pointer to actual object */
62 unsigned int x; /* Extra information - reuse count etc */
63 } al_thread_t; /* identify a thread */
64 typedef void *al_mutex_t; /* identify a mutex */
65 typedef void *al_cond_t; /* identify a condition variable */
66#else
67/* other? */
68#if defined(AM_BARE_METAL)
69 #error "What is the type of a thread handle?"
70#elif defined(AM_FREERTOS)
71 #include <pthread.h>
72 #define al_thread_t pthread_t
73 #define al_mutex_t pthread_mutex_t
74 #define al_cond_t pthread_cond_t
75#endif
76
77#endif
78/* Function: al_mutex_init
79 Initialize a mutex.
80*/
81int al_mutex_init(al_mutex_t *mutex);
82/* Function: al_mutex_lock
83 Lock a mutex.
84*/
85int al_mutex_lock(al_mutex_t *mutex);
86/* Function: al_mutex_trylock
87 Non-blocking mutex lock.
88*/
89int al_mutex_trylock(al_mutex_t *mutex);
90/* Function: al_mutex_unlock
91 Unlock a mutex.
92*/
93int al_mutex_unlock(al_mutex_t *mutex);
94/* Function: al_mutex_lock
95 Destroy a mutex.
96*/
97int al_mutex_destroy(al_mutex_t *mutex);
98
99/* Function: al_cond_init
100 Initialize a cond variable.
101*/
102int al_cond_init(al_cond_t *cond);
103/* Function: al_cond_signal
104 Signal on a cond variable.
105*/
106int al_cond_signal(al_cond_t *cond);
107/* Function: al_cond_broadcast
108 Broadcast on a cond variable.
109*/
110int al_cond_broadcast(al_cond_t *cond);
111/* Function: al_cond_wait
112 Wait on a cond variable, releasing an associated mutex.
113*/
114int al_cond_wait(al_cond_t *cond, al_mutex_t *mutex);
115/* Function: al_cond_destroy
116 Destroy a cond variable.
117*/
118int al_cond_destroy(al_cond_t *cond);
119
120/* Function: al_thread_create
121 Create a new thread
122
123 Parameters:
124 thread - pointer to a thread structure
125 start_routine - pointer to the function to invoke for the new thread
126 arg - argument to pass to the start_routine
127*/
128int al_thread_create(al_thread_t * thread, void *(*start_routine)(void *), void * arg);
129/* Function: al_thread_join
130 Wait for a thread to complete.
131*/
132int al_thread_join(al_thread_t thread, void **thread_return);
133#endif /* of not using native pthread */
134
135/* Function : al_timer_create
136 TODO : Create a new timer.
137 The timer will signal after _millisecs_ passed.
138*/
139void al_timer_create(e_u32 millisecs);
140/* Function : al_timer_destroy
141 TODO : Destroy a timer created with <al_timer_create>.
142*/
143void al_timer_destroy(void);
144
145/* Structure: mith_iextend
146 Extended information on work items
147*/
148typedef struct mith_iextend_s {
149 e_u32 item_id;
150 e_u32 kernel_id;
151 e_u32 verify;
152} mith_iextend;
153/* Structure: mith_textend
154 Extended information for new threads created
155*/
156typedef struct mith_textend_s {
157 /* item, kernel and sub_item ids, currently to be used for affinity */
158 e_u32 item_id;
159 e_u32 kernel_id;
160 e_u32 sub_item_id;
161} mith_textend;
162/* Function: al_thread_create_ex
163 Create a new thread, potentially setting affinity.
164 This function is used by some work items to allow affinity on sub threads created by the work item.
165
166 Parameters:
167 thread - pointer to a thread structure
168 start_routine - pointer to the function to invoke for the new thread
169 arg - argument to pass to the start_routine
170 tex - extra information for thread create extensions.
171*/
172int al_thread_create_ex(al_thread_t * thread, void *(*start_routine)(void *), void * arg, mith_textend *tex);
173
174/* Function: al_setaffinity
175 Description:
176 If affinity is supported, can potentially use affinity to set specific work items to specific affinity.
177 This function controls the way affinity is assigned to new work items being executed.
178
179 Parameters:
180 Item identifiers - kernel and instance (unique) as well as serial item id,
181 and context_id representing the harness view of items running in parallel.
182
183 Porting:
184 This function needs to be ported if affinity for work items is desired.
185 This affects the work item affinity at the harness level, since this function is
186 called before each work item starts initialization and processing.
187*/
188int al_item_setaffinity(int kernel_id, int instance_id, int item_id, e_u32 context_id);
189
190/* Structure: hardware_info_t
191 Structure containing hardware specific information
192
193 Porting:
194 This structure can be changed when porting to different platforms, even for OTB cerstifications
195*/
196typedef struct hardware_info_s {
197 int num_processors;
198 char *description_string;
199 /* this structure may be extended with info regarding specific processor capabilities,
200 and other platform specific information */
201} hardware_info_t;
202
203/* Variable: hardware_info
204 Global value, set before any threads are created.
205 Once actual execution starts, this structure must be read only
206*/
207extern hardware_info_t hardware_info;
208
209/* Function: al_set_hardware_info
210 Set hardware specific information from a string.
211
212 Porting:
213 This function must be ported to specific hardware if intending to use
214 information more then just number of processors.
215*/
216void al_set_hardware_info(char *pdescription);
217
218#endif /*_AL_SMP_H*/
